___PayloadCertificateUUID.description: UUID of the certificate payload containing an identity used as the client credential

___PayloadIdentifier.description: A unique identifier for the payload, dot-delimited.  Usually root PayloadIdentifier+subidentifier

___EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.description: The minimum number of RAND values accepted from the server. 3 is the default, and 2 is allowed, but offers less security. For use with EAP-SIM only.

___PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.description: Array of UUIDs corresponding to the trusted certificates for this authentication

items.description: A UUID for a trusted certificate

___OuterIdentity.description: If TTLS, PEAP, or EAP-FAST is used, this string is used instead of the user's identity outside the encrypted tunnel. This value can be used to mask the true identity of the person using the network

___TTLSInnerAuthentication.description: Specifies the inner authentication used by the TTLS module

items.description: An integer representing an EAP type, inside of the Accept EAP Types array

___EAPFASTUsePAC.description: If set, the device will use an existing PAC if it's present. Otherwise the server must present its identity using a certificate

___UserPassword.description: Password. If not provided, the user may be prompted during login

___UserName.description: Username. If not provided, the user may be prompted during login

___TLSTrustedServerNames.description: Array of Common Names of server certificates that can be trusted. The wildcard * can be used to match a range of strings

items.description: An item in the TLS Trusted Server Names array representing a Common Name of a server certificate.

___TLSAllowTrustExceptions.description: No longer supported in iOS 8 and later

___EAPFASTProvisionPACAnonymously.description: If set, provisions the device anonymously. Note that there are known man-in-the-middle attacks for anonymous provisioning

___OneTimeUserPassword.description: If set, the user will be prompted for a password each time they connect to the network

___ProxyPACURL.description: URL used to recieve proxy settings

___CaptiveBypass.description: Do not show the captive network sheet

___TLSCertificateRequired.description: If set, force a non-default authentication method. (if YES, uses certificate from PayloadCertificateUUID)

___EncryptionType.description: Wireless network encryption to use when connecting. The None value is available in iOS 5.0 and later and the WPA2 value is available in iOS 8.0 and later.

___Password.description: Specifies the password for the access point

___QoSMarkingAppleAudioVideoCalls.description: Enable QoS for WiFi Calling, FaceTime, SMS, etc.

___QoSMarkingEnabled.description: Enable any kind of QoS marking

___QoSMarkingWhitelistedAppIdentifiers.description: Whitelist specific apps for QoS marking

___PayloadType.description: The type of the payload, a reverse dns string

___ProxyPassword.description: The password to authenticate with the proxy

___ProxyType.description: The type of proxy configuration to use for this wireless connection

___PayloadOrganization.description: This value describes the issuing organization of the profile, as displayed to the user

___HIDDEN_NETWORK.description: If set, assumes the network is hidden. Otherwise the device will use broadcast SSID to identify the network.

___ProxyServer.description: The hostname of the proxy server

___SSID_STR.description: SSID of the Wi-Fi network to be used

___PayloadVersion.description: The version of the whole configuration profile.

___ProxyServerPort.description: The port used to connect to the proxy server

___ProxyUsername.description: The username for proxy server authentication

___IsHotspot.description: Is a legacy or Hotspot 2.0 network
